result.execSummary:
The defendant Luis A Sanchez-Frankie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the DOC. Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Cash bail applied.
- No firearms/weapons. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management counseling.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No Contact with victim, without prior approval by the court or agent and UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to No Violent Contact.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
- Not to be involved in any conduct which rises to the level of probable cause that the defendant has violated a criminal law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luis A Sanchez-Frankie

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Luis A Sanchez-Frankie in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Sworn as interpreter:  Dawn Maldonado.

CASE HEARD BY BRANCH 44, JUDGE KONKOL FOR BRANCH 40, JUDGE DALLET.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.  Additional statements by the victim.  

Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 1 DAY time served; Straight time.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, without prior approval by the court or agent and UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  
Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Not to be involved in any conduct which rises to the level of probable cause that the defendant has violated a criminal law.

Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition. 

Received and filed: 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.

Defendant Luis A Sanchez-Frankie in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Interpreter waived by the defense.  Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 7/20/15 in Branch 40.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Luis A Sanchez-Frankie in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pretrial Conference held.  Without objection of the Court, Attorney Borda waived the appearance of an interpreter for today's proceedings. Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 05-12-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Luis A Sanchez-Frankie
Current: 2133 W. Grant, Milwaukee, WI 53215   (Effective: 04-27-2015)
Prior: 1622 S 21st St, Milwaukee, WI 53204
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Adelaida R. or her residence or place of employment

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br.40.vb

Defendant Luis A Sanchez-Frankie in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04-19-15
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
